column3: (Net Income - Preferred Dividends) / Number of Shares Outstanding
column8: How much the firm earns in net income for each share outstanding

column3: Market Value per Share / Earnings per Share
column8: Valuation of current share price to per share earnings
How much money a firm generated with the equity invested by shareholders
A measure to determine whether the company can pay off its short term liabilities
How many current assets per single current liability. Measure of company's health.
The amount of readily available assets that could be used to cover current liabilities
How effective a firm is at collecting its debt

column3: Cost of Goods Sold / Average Inventory
column8: How many times a company's inventory is sold and replaced (for 2012)
The amount of income before any expenses other than COGS
The amount a company makes in gross profit for every dollar of sales
Pre interest and tax earnings (EBIT)
EBIT per dollar of sales
The measure of a company's financial leverage. How much debt it has per dollar of shareholder investment

column3: (Total Shareholder Equity - Preferred Equity) / Total Outstanding Shares
column8: The amount of money per share after all debts are paid

column2: Cash From Operations to Current Liabilities
column3: Cash From Operating Activities / Average Current Liabilities
column8: Represents to what degree cash from operations covers current liabilities for the year
The amount from each dollar of sales that represents bottom line profit
How efficient management is at using assets to generate earnings

column3: Net Income / (Long Term Debt + Shareholders Equity)
column8: Net income as a percentage of long term capital

column3: Sales / Total Assets at Start of Year
column8: How much in sales is generated by a dollar in total assets

column3: Long Term Debt / (Long Term Debt + Equity)
column8: How much of every dollar of long term capital is debt
Leverage indicator. How much debt per dollar of the company's capital exists.
How much of the company is financed with debt
How much of the company is financed with equity
The extent to which interest obligations are covered by earnings
The extent to which interest obligations are covered by earnings without considering depreciation

column2: Net Working Capital to Total Assets Ratio
column8: How much per dollar in assets a company would have if current liabilties were called
The amount of cash and equivalents a firm has to cover its short term obligations
How much of the company's earnings was distributed to shareholders
How much of the company's earnings was reinvested in the business

column3: Earnings - Dividends / Equity: Alt: Plowback Ratio X ROE
column8: The firm's growth rate if it plows back a constant fraction of its earnings, maintains a constant ROE, and keeps its debt ratio constant
